image.altText: A close-up shot of a policeman wearing badges

props.synopsis: Northern Territory Police Commissioner Michael Murphy is the senior public official found by the NT's corruption watchdog to have engaged in improper conduct.

title.children: NT police commissioner outs himself as subject of anti-corruption probe

image.altText: A man with white hair and beard wearing sunglasses

props.synopsis: An industrial manslaughter prosecution over the death of a Darwin construction worker in 2020 could be over before it begins after NT WorkSafe failed to turn over hundreds of documents.

title.children: 'Cluster of epic proportions': Industrial manslaughter prosecution derailed

image.altText: The outline of kids boarding a school bus can just be seen through the reflective glass of the bus windscreen.

props.synopsis: Parents in Katherine are urging the Northern Territory government to increase safety measures on school buses, after raising the alarm about fighting and bullying onboard.

title.children: Katherine parents raise alarm over violence, bullying on school buses

image.altText: A locked gate with a large 'no unauthorised entry' sign affixed to it.

props.synopsis: The company operating the Northern Territory's McArthur River Mine, one of the world's largest lead and zinc mines, has been convicted and fined for unlawful works on a sacred site spanning 13 years.

title.children: Mining giant fined for unlawful works on NT sacred site over 13 years

image.altText: A boy wearing a light green swim rashy, has two hands on a water pump and smiles at the camera in a school playground.

props.synopsis: James and Ollie are the best of friends, but they don't get to see each other very often. That's why they love "in-school week" at Alice Springs School of the Air.

title.children: In-school week 'really, really important' to remote station kids

image.altText: A double-lane street lined with trees and a tall building on the left. A ute is driving away

props.synopsis: The man was allegedly attacked by three people on Mitchell Street, with police describing the incident as a "disgraceful attack on a vulnerable member of our society".

title.children: 101yo on mobility scooter target of 'disgraceful attack' in Darwin CBD

image.altText: An aerial view of a setting sun on a small settlement next to a tropical bay

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory's Country Liberal Party government was elected on a tough on crime mandate. The NT's biggest remote community is accusing it of overlooking that in the bush.

title.children: Remote NT community grappling with its own crime crisis

image.altText: A close-up of Donald Trump, who wears a suit and US flag pin and glances sideways.

props.synopsis: As Democrats heckled and Republicans cheered, four robed figures sat silently through Donald Trump's speech. They could form part of his biggest barrier.

title.children: While Democrats heckled, Trump's biggest obstacles sat quietly

image.altText: A man dressed in a smoking jacket and sailors hat

props.synopsis: The estranged wife of AFL player Rick Olarenshaw and an Australian couple were arrested last year during separate raids on spas that Balinese police said were  "providing pornographic services".

title.children: Influencer and Aussie couple sentenced to seven months for illegal Bali spas

image.altText: South Korean KF-16 fighter jets fly in the sky

props.synopsis: South Korea's Air Force say eight 225kg Mk82 bombs from KF-16 jets fell during military exercises in Pocheon.

title.children: South Korea air force jets accidentally drop bombs on homes

image.altText: Albanese stands at a lectern, a digital weather map behind him.

props.synopsis: The prime minister has left himself the option of calling the election this weekend, as Tropical Cyclone Alfred bears down on Queensland and northern NSW.

title.children: PM leaves door open to calling election in days after cyclone

image.altText: Brisbane Broncos congratulate teammate Selwyn Cobbo on a try.

props.synopsis: The Broncos carry on as they started in their NRL season opener against the Roosters with a sensational Selwyn Cobbo try to start the second half. Follow live.

title.children: Broncos continue Roosters smash-up with sensational triple-kick try

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: 54' TRY: Ben Hunt scores on his Brisbane return
48' TRY: Cobbo has another as Brisbane pile on the points
44' TRY: Cobbo finishes off a Brisbane party trick

image.altText: Men and women sit and stand around a long table in a narrow hallway.

props.synopsis: Karyn Walsh of Micah Projects says staff and volunteers will continue to encourage homeless people to accept a bed as long as driving is possible.

title.children: Volunteers race to bring homeless people indoors as cyclone condition heightens

image.altText: Anthony Albanese and Cabinet January 2025

props.synopsis: President Donald Trump's pick to lead US Pentagon policy expressed concern over Australia's low defence spend. The prime minister insists significant investment has been made and defence spending will continue to rise.

title.children: Albanese responds to Trump camp 'concern' on Australia's defence spend

image.altText: A view of soldiers in army gear from behind with firey shots ahead of them from cannon.

props.synopsis: One expert says the CIA's move to stop sharing intelligence with Ukraine will have an instantaneous impact on the battlefield. Here's what we know.

title.children: What we know about the US decision to cut intelligence sharing with Ukraine

image.altText: A man wearing a suit speaks at a lectern

props.synopsis: High Commissioner Phil Goff has lost his job for comments in which he appeared to question US President Donald Trump's grasp of history.

title.children: NZ sacks high commissioner to UK over comments critical of Trump

image.altText: Toyah Cordingley smiling as she sits in front of a Christmas tree.

props.synopsis: Jurors were shown the location where Toyah Cordingley's body was found before hearing evidence from witnesses who say they saw a man behaving strangely at the scene.

title.children: Court hears of 'suspicious' man on beach before Toyah Cordingley's death

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A mugshot style photo of a man in his twenties in a tshirt

props.synopsis: Police feared a healthcare murderer could have been a serial killer after they searched his bedroom and found stolen medical items and a collection of death notices.

title.children: Mysterious stash of funeral notices raises fears of a serial killer's 'trophies'

props.synopsis: Cyclone Alfred is due to cross the coast on Friday morning. Track wind speeds at key locations in the cyclone zone.

title.children: Track wind speeds live as Cyclone Alfred approaches coast

image.altText: Two people stand behind podiums and microphones

props.synopsis: As WA's election day nears, the campaign has grown increasingly bumpy for both Labor and the Liberals with some unwanted distractions.

title.children: The attack dogs are out in the final week of the WA election campaign

image.altText: Stuart Macgill wearing a suit and tie and glasses

props.synopsis: Former cricketer Stuart MacGill, 54, steps into the witness box during a trial after pleading not guilty to taking part in the supply of a prohibited drug.

title.children: Stuart MacGill tells court 'no way' he was setting up drug deal

image.altText: People looking at a map on a wall showing Tropical Cyclone Alfred.

props.synopsis: Here's how non-English speakers can get emergency updates and information on how to prepare as Cyclone Alfred approaches.

title.children: How non-English speakers can stay informed as Cyclone Alfred approaches

image.altText: Fred Stolle holds a trophy

props.synopsis: Fred Stolle, who won two grand slam singles titles and was a three-time Davis Cup champion for Australia during the nation's greatest era of tennis, has died aged 86.

title.children: Grand slam, Davis Cup winner and commentary legend Stolle dies aged 86

image.altText: A man with medium-length hair wearing a blue t-shirt smiles while sitting on a couch.

props.synopsis: Family and jury members endure distressing photos of an alleged murder victim, and his cause of death, during a murder trial in Tasmania's Supreme Court.

title.children: Jury shown evidence of brutal last moments of murder victim

image.altText: A man with a septum piercing, neck tattoos and long hair looks at the camera.

props.synopsis: Lawyers for an Arizona man charged in connection with a deadly attack on Queensland police have asked a court to exclude evidence from Australian investigators from his trial.

title.children: US court urged to ban Qld Police evidence from Wieambilla shooting case

image.altText: A crowd of people watch from an esplanade as powerful surf slams into shore.

props.synopsis: For many in south-east Queensland and northern NSW a trip to the beach before the cyclone's onslaught has proved irresistible, but those on the Gold Coast are risking stiff penalties.

title.children: Beachgoers warned of $16k fines as Alfred whips up massive surf

image.altText: a stay at home sign on a beach front

props.synopsis: There's been a lot of talk about preparing as the cyclone moves nearer to the Queensland and New South Wales coasts, but what are you supposed to do when it's happening?

title.children: What should I be doing as the cyclone hits?

image.altText: Man with black hair and beard wears yellow shirt and smiles looking off to side.

props.synopsis: The vibraphone player and producer is one of the most sampled artists in popular music.

title.children: Never heard of Roy Ayers? You probably know his biggest hits

image.altText: A Tasmanian devil hunched near a residential toilet

props.synopsis: A snake catcher uses tactics usually reserved for unwanted reptiles after a Tasmanian devil took shelter from pursuing dogs behind a toilet — while a woman was sitting down.

title.children: Tasmanian devil gives woman on toilet a big surprise

image.altText: A grey speckled bowl is seen sitting atop a glass table with a white flokati rug underneath. The bowl is filled with a poke dish

props.synopsis: If you have access to a BBQ or gas cooker, or even just fridge and pantry staples, there are plenty of options for dishing-up something delicious during a blackout.

title.children: Preparing for a cyclone power outage? Simple meals you can make

image.altText: The pope, dressed all in white, makes a blessing gesture with one hand.

props.synopsis: Pope Francis has resumed some works while battling double pneumonia with a severe respiratory infection in the hospital for almost three weeks.

title.children: Pope resumes some work and remains in a stable condition, Vatican says

image.altText: A close-up of three Grand Theft Auto characters looking towards the camera.

props.synopsis: How do you stage a classic play inside a violent, virtual world? During lockdown, two out-of-work actors decided to try.

title.children: Shakespeare enters the virtual world in new doco Grand Theft Hamlet
